_prev_prog_3.Description: WinCo's implementation of the RMP/PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee exposure to accidental releases. The plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program(mechanical integrity) for the ammonia system components, and a program for both pre-startup safety reviews and management of change(MOC)to the ammonia refrigeration system. The program also includes operating procedures for the safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requirements for safe work practices (such as safe approaches to welding and other hot work), safety requirements for contractors who may be hired to work on the refrigeration system. WinCo has a procedure in place for investigating incidents to ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions to minimize the potential for recurrence of incidents. The program also has a component for conducting compliance audits audits to ensure the facility's RMP/PSM program is being implemented at WinCo's Denton facility. Lastly the RMP?PSM program incorporates the facilities emergency Action plan and places special emphasis on handling accidental releases of ammonia and coordination of emergency response activities with the local fire authority and other response agencies as well as the applicable ocal, state and federal regulatory agencies.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
WinCo is a diversified retailer of grocery products throughout the western United States. WinCo currently operates 10 retail grocery stores in the State of Texas and 4 in the State of Oklahoma that aresupplied out of WinCo's Distribution Center (DC) located in Denton, TX. WinCo's Denton DC has 110 employees and utilizes anhydrous ammonia  for refrigeration of perishable grocery products in storage. Anhydrous ammonia is subject to EPA Regulation under 40 CFR 68, Accidental Release Risk Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals. 



Pursuant to RMP Regulations and OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations, WinCo has developed a comprehensive RMP/PSM written program to protect employees and the surrounding community from exposure to hazardous chemicals (anhydrous ammonia) located on site. the facility completed a process hazard analysis (PHA) for the ammonia refrigeration system using the industry standard What-If Checklist Analysis developed through the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR). The PHA was completed using the Refrigeration Contractor that was building the system, the general contractor, the refrigeration contractor retained by WinCo to operate and maintain the refrigeration system, Facility Maintenance Managers from WinCo's other ammonia refrigerated DC's, WinCo's Warehouse Manager for the Denton DC and WinCo's Director of Environmental Compliance.  The PHA was facilitated by an experienced RMP/PSM refrigeration engineer from Republic Refrigeration.



WinCo's implementation of the RMP/PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental releases. The Plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program (Mechanical Integrity) for the ammonia refrigeration system components, and a program for both pre-startup safety reviews and management of change (MOC) to the ammonia refrigeration system.  In addition the program includes spec

ific requirements for safe work practices  (such as safe approaches to welding and similar (hot work), and safety requirement for contractors hired to work on the refrigeration system.  



WinCo is committed to minimizing accidental releases from the refrigeration system at its Denton, TX DC. Facility Management is involved in the operation and maintenance of the refrigeration system and its compliance with all applicable regulations.  WinCo's employees are involved  in the development of the facilities RMP/PSM program. WinCo management is committed to working with local agencies and the community to educate the public regarding the hazards of ammonia and to ensure a safe environment.  Questions regarding RMP/PSM compliance at WinCo's Denton DC  should be addressed to WinCo's Director of Environmental Compliance
